message:
Shibir condemns media lies against it:

Shibir has even no remoter connection with bombs and gunpowder hauled in Mohammadpur- Chhatrashibir


Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir strongly slammed and gainsaid false and baseless reports titled “3 Shibir men caught with two hundred hand bombs in Mohammadpur” aired some print and electronic media.

In a joint gainsaying statement, the Secretary-General of Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir Abdul Zabbar and Dhaka Metropolitan City West Shibir Secretary Tamim Hussain said, “Some online media such as Banglanews24.com, Natun Barta, sheershanews, 71 TV, Channel 24, Independent TV, Machranga TV etc habitually published untrue and baseless reports against Chhatrashibir. The report is totally void of any evidentiary elements and said, based on the statement of Mohammadpur Thana O.C. Azizul Hoque alone, that 2 hundred bombs had been seized by cops from a mess of Shibir at Mohammadpur in the capital. The reports also spoke about arrest of 3 Shibir activists in that regard. But, interestingly, in Mohammadpur’s Rajia Sultana road wherein the incident took place, there is no mess of Chhatrashibir. Eevn no single statement of Mohammadpur Thana Chhatrashibir leaders has been included in the said reports. We’d like to confidently say that Chhatrashibir has even no remoter connection with this incident and none of the arrestees belongs to Chhatrashibir. We believe that such reporting can in no way be treated as positive journalism; rather, we think it’s a part of pro-government agenda.”

The leaders urged the concerned media and media men not to publish such false and baseless reports furthermore.
